page.title: 12OAKENCLOUGH:RURAL LIFESTYLES
page.content: By the nature of the area,life styles are of necessity somewhat self contained.Social opportunities are extremely restricted and,due to the scattered nature of the community,are dependent upon the possession of personal transport.When asked "when you Â£go out'what form does the evening take?" Responses varied from having a meal out,visiting relatives and friends womens institute activites,to dances in village halls in nearby areas. There is no village hall in the area. The only public house,the Moorcock Inn, is a social venue largely serving the needs of car owning people from outside the area.At this inn meals are served and there is often live music. Home activities included gardening,reading, embroidery and renovating old cars.One of the elder resident said there ought to be "something for young ones."
